Future Cars Edition - Sure, the calendar says we're only halfway through 2007, but here at HowStuffWorks we've always got our eyes on the future. In this edition of the Automotive newsletter, we take you forward in time to see car models from 2008, 2009 and even 2010. Check out our future cars 
image gallery.   This week's trivia question:
The man who invented the Smart Car also invented a type of wristwatch that was wildly popular in the 1980s. Can you name that watch? Find out here   
 
Future Cars - They're right around the corner and come from every corner of the globe. This article lets you peek into the new-car showroom of tomorrow. Check out the new cars, trucks and SUVs going on sale in the coming months and years, so you can decide whether to buy today or wait for what's on the horizon. 
    This week's video:How Segways Work
 - What if the cars of the future weren't cars at all, but scooter-like vehicles that run on ordinary household electricity? If inventor Dean Kamen has any say about it, the Segway human transporter will be the vehicle of the future. Learn how the Segway works in this video. 
     Also at HowStuffWorks:
 
The R8: On the Track With Audi's New Mid-Engine Exotic - Consumer Guide's reviewer took a hot lap in the Audi R8 around the storied Road America race course with professional driver Michael Galati at the wheel. Read his impressions. 
 
How the Smart Car Works - Already popular in Europe, the Smart Car is small in stature but big on economy. The updated Smart Fortwo is ready for release in 2008, so we could be seeing a lot more Smart Cars in the near future. 
 
2008 Maserati GranTurismo Review - The 2008 Maserati GranTurismo dumps the lumpy form of the outgoing Maserati GT for an aggressive new shape stretched over a longer chassis. Read the full review.
